required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparing Treatment of Dry Eye With Intracanlicular Dexamethasone, Restasis, and/or Lotemax
clinical_study.official_title: Intracanalicular Dexamethasone Used in Conjunction With Restasis (Cyclosporine Ophthalmic Emulsion) for the Treatment of Signs and Symptoms of Dry Eye Disease as Compared to Restasis With Lotemax (Loteprednol Etabonate Ophthalmic Suspension 0.5%) and Restasis Monotherapy.

brief_summary.textblock: This 6 month study seeks to compare the use of Intracanalicular Dexamethasone in conjunction with Restasis (cyclosporine ophthalmic emulsion) for the treatment of signs and symptoms of dry eye disease as compared to Restasis with Lotemax (loteprednol etabonate ophthalmic suspension 0.5%) and Restasis monotherapy.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: 10 subjects will receive Restasis and Dextenza 10 subjects will receive Restasis and Lotemax 10 subjects will receive Restasis

primary_outcome.measure: Mean change in ocular surface staining
primary_outcome.description: Mean change in ocular surface staining measured by the NEI grading scale

secondary_outcome.description: Change in MMP-9 measured by InflammaDry

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change in tear break-up time (TBUT)

secondary_outcome.description: Change in conjunctival injection measured on a scale of 0-4 and graded by physician

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in meibomian gland scores
secondary_outcome.description: Meibomian gland scores through expression and quality
Change in tear osmolarity as measured by Tear Lab
Change in DEQ-5 as patient reported

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change in Best-corrected Visual Acuity (BCVA
secondary_outcome.description: Chnage in best-corrected visual acuity measured by ETDRS chart
Change in Schirmer's score measured by Schirmer's test strip

arm_group.description: 10 subjects will be receiving Restasis ophthalmic solution twice a day in both eyes and Lotemax ophthalmic solution twice a day in both eyes.
10 subjects will be receiving Restasis ophthalmic solution twice a day in both eyes, as well as receiving Dextenza insertion in both lower lids.
10 subjects will be receiving Restasis ophthalmic solution twice a day in both eyes

intervention.description: Used to increase tear production in patients who have dry eye caused by inflammation
Used to treat inflammation of the eye
Used to treat inflammation of the eye

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 years of age or older
- Signs and symptoms of DED
- Consent to treat with topical immunomodulator
- Willing and able to comply with clinic visits and study related procedures
- Willing and able to sign the informed consent form
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients under the age of 18.
- Pregnancy (must be ruled out in women of child-bearing age with pregnancy test)
- Active infectious systemic disease
- Active infectious ocular or extraocular disease
- Altered nasolacrimal flow of either acquired, induced, or congenital origin
- Hypersensitivity to dexamethasone
- Patients who have been on topical immunomodulating agents in the previous 3 months to their baseline visit
- Patient being treated with either topical, oral, or intravenous immunosuppressive agents, immunomodulating agents, or steroid (including NSAIDS)
- Patients with severe disease that warrants critical attention, deemed unsafe for the study by the investigator
